question.text: After this hazard you should test your brakes. Why is this?

explanation.text: A ford is a crossing over a stream that’s shallow enough to go through. After you’ve gone through a ford or deep puddle the water will affect your brakes. To dry them out apply a light brake pressure while moving slowly. Don’t travel at normal speeds until you are sure your brakes are working properly again.

answer.text: You will be on a slippery road
Your brakes will be soaking wet
You will be going down a long hill
You will have just crossed a long bridge
